description: Initial digit of Fibonacci number F(n).
comments: Benford's law applies since the Fibonacci sequence is of exponential growth: P(d)=log_10(1+1/d), in fact among first 5000 values the digit d=1 appears 1505 times, while 5000*P(1) is about 1505.15. [_Carmine Suriano_, Feb 14 2011]
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=0..1000
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
